6.2.4 ATTRIBUTES

6.2.4.2 FEATURE ATTRIBUTES

Feature attributes are geometric properties. Generally, all these properties are used in defining and evaluating a feature for design correctness. In defining a complex feature, an absolute value or the property of one feature can be used in relation to another feature in refining the definition of a complex feature. Properties discerned to be sufficient in defining and evaluating complex features are as follow:

Height

Width/Thickness/Diameter

Draft

Orientation

Models for Concurrent Engineering Design - 15 Jul 1997
